alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Frost Advisory issued April 18 at 3:16AM EDT until April 18 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 31 will result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Western Monmouth, Ocean, Atlantic and Southeastern Burlington. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, until 9 AM EDT this morning. For the Wind Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 5 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington; Western Monmouth
